greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of compositions of n into k primes (i.e., ordered sequences of k primes having sum n; n>=2, k>=1).
comment: Sum of terms in row n = A023360(n).
T(n,1) = A010051(n) (characteristic function of primes); T(n,2) = A073610(n); T(n,3) = A098238(n).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 2..200, flattened
maple: G:=1/(1-t*sum(z^ithprime(i),i=1..30))-1: Gser:=simplify(series(G,z=0,25)): for n from 2 to 21 do P[n]:=sort(coeff(Gser,z,n)) od: for n from 2 to 21 do seq(coeff(P[n],t,j),j=1..floor(n/2)) od; # yields sequence in triangular form
b:= proc(n) option remember; local j; if n=0 then [1]
else []; for j to pi(n) do zip((x, y)->x+y, %,
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Aug 06 2006
